Constant Field Values

USERS

public static final java.lang.String[] USERS
these are the user names recognized by vista to allow for flagging of data. Make only additions to this array. Any deletion will result in mismatches with the older ids that were in use.

DSSUtil

public DSSUtil()
Method Detail

createDataReference

public static DataReference createDataReference(java.lang.String server,
                                                java.lang.String filename,
                                                java.lang.String pathname,
                                                DataSet ds)
creates a data reference with given server,file and pathname and a data set. If the dataset is null a reference is created which will retrieve the data from the given input parameters

readData

public static DataSet readData(java.lang.String filename,
                               java.lang.String pathname,
                               boolean retrieveFlags)
reads in data from a DSS database

Parameters:
filename - name of dss data base
pathname - name of data to be read
retrieveFlags - true if flags are to be read
Returns:
the data set containing the values
See Also:
DataSet, RegularTimeSeries, IrregularTimeSeries, DefaultDataSet

writeData

                             java.lang.String pathname,
                             DataSet ds)
writes out data to dss data base

Parameters:
filename - name of dss database
pathname - name of data
ds - data set

Pathname, DataSet

createDataReference

public static DataReference createDataReference(java.lang.String serverName,
                                                java.lang.String filename,
                                                Pathname path)
creates a data reference from a servername, filename, pathname. For calculating the timewindow it uses the pathnames D PART. The format for the D PART should be ddMMMyyyy HHmm - ddMMMyyyy HHmm or just ddMMMyyyy HHmm

createGroup

public static Group createGroup(java.lang.String serverName,
                                java.lang.String dssFilename)
creates a group from a server name, port number and filename

createSession

public static Session createSession(java.lang.String serverName,
                                    java.lang.String directory)
create a session of groups corresponding to the dssfilename. This is the default configuration where each group corresponds to each dssfilename. Subsequent groups created by the user are stored else where...

setClientPortNumber

public static void setClientPortNumber(int n)
set port number on which to contact the server

getClientPortNumber

public static int getClientPortNumber()
set port number on which to contact the server

checks if user with username has access to update database

updateData

public static void updateData(DataReference ref,
                              boolean storeFlags)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
updates database for the given reference and storing flags if storeFlags is true

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getTimeFactory

public static TimeFactory getTimeFactory()
returns the instance of time factory used for this database

createTimeWindow

public static TimeWindow createTimeWindow(Pathname path)
creates a time window from given pathname with given time interval format
ddMMMyyyy HHmm - ddMMMyyyy HHmm ; e.g. 01JAN1990 0100 - 01MAY1993 1400
or
ddMMMyyyy HHmm

createTimeInterval

public static TimeInterval createTimeInterval(Pathname path)
creates a time interval from the given path. The time interval is determined from the E PART of the pathname

getDefaultServer

public static java.lang.String getDefaultServer()
the default server for the dss files

getDefaultDirectory

public static java.lang.String getDefaultDirectory()
the default directory for the database

areFlagsRetrieved

public static boolean areFlagsRetrieved()
true if flags are to be retrieved

isLocalAccessEnabled

public static boolean isLocalAccessEnabled()
true if local access is enabled. This means the server "local" is not interpreted as a machine name

setAccessProperties

public static void setAccessProperties(java.util.Properties props)
sets the access properties from the given properties object. The properties set are default.server, default.dir, default.port dss.flags, dss.localAccess

writeText

public static void writeText(DataReference[] refs,
                             java.lang.String dssFile,
                             java.lang.String textFile)
                      throws java.io.IOException
writes in text format dssts or dssits compatible.

Parameters:
refs - an array of data references to be written out
Throws:
java.io.IOException
